ai-mil5.3.10:1.1_0: “Venerable Sir, the Buddha has said these words:

ai-mil5.3.10:2.2_0: the supreme king of the teaching.
ai-mil5.3.10:2.3_0: By the teaching I roll forth the wheel
ai-mil5.3.10:3.1_0: the Buddha has said these words:
ai-mil5.3.10:3.2_0: ‘If others praise me, the teaching, or the Saṅgha, don’t make yourselves thrilled, elated, and excited.’ That’s what you need.
ai-mil5.3.10:3.3_0: If they were to praise even when praised by the word of a brahmin, let alone those who speak in accordance with the Teaching.

ai-mil5.3.10:4.1_0: “Great king, the Buddha has spoken about this:
ai-mil5.3.10:4.2_0: ‘If others praise me, the teaching, or the Saṅgha, don’t make yourselves thrilled, elated, and elated.’
ai-mil5.3.10:4.3_0: as happens to one of those good qualities, other brahmin compared to each other, so they praised it.
ai-mil5.3.10:5.2_0: the supreme king of the teaching.
ai-mil5.3.10:5.3_0: By the teaching I roll forth the wheel
ai-mil5.3.10:6.1_0: First the Buddha has stated the Dhamma marks which rewards, and not unevenness, discoveredness, as the underlying tendencies for himself, the creators of danger, and the discovering of the island.
ai-mil5.3.10:6.2_0: ‘If others praise me, the teaching, or the Saṅgha, don’t make yourselves thrilled, elated, and elated.’
ai-mil5.3.10:6.3_0: And when the Buddha praises those various kinds of good conduct by the Buddha, he praises more than that,
ai-mil5.3.10:6.4_0: ‘I am a king of the teaching!’ But the king of the past, future, or present will not accept a meal of compassion for the sake of himself. And if he does not say, his pupils of the Dhamma, becomes the reason why he thinks:
ai-mil5.3.10:6.5_0: ‘I am a king, king of Dhamma. I am the supreme king of the teaching.’”
ai-mil5.3.10:6.6_0: “Good, sir, would you agree with such a dragon?”
